description: Tried to connect to RDP of Windows Server. It always either crashes trying to connect or fails authentication 100% time.
Very bad, many lag, crash, multiplem problems
pretty much the same as gnome boxes but for remote servers works a charm
poes software
Keyboard not working after focus changed from Connections to another app.
Doen't support quality, audio, or even keyboard command passthrough settings. Image quality is also much worse than other clients, like Remmina.
Tried to connect to a VNC server and did not work. If others are having problems with Gnome Connections then try out Remmina.
summary: Tested for VNC, did not work

description: I logged in to my windows PC and saw the desktop for a few seconds before it crashed. Completely unusable.

No clue why VNC connections has been separated from boxes. 

Connections is very unstable with Fedora 35. Switching to Remmina.
I read about this on Fedoramagazine and gave it a go. I would assume at the very least it would support ssh, rdp and vnc - but there's no ssh support
Enable share and made sure vnc was running. Nope, still wouldn't let me connect. Pretended the other PC didn't exist.

This is simply an unfinished app. I don't understand how did it even get to the repo and got labeled as "stable". The only configuration available is the address of the remote. You can't even change the resolution, which makes it pretty much unusable for any kind of real work.

While it works well and is fairly stable, it is way too basic for productive use in RDP sessions, there is no way of controlling resolution and there is no option for keeping aspect ratio when scaling.
Cant even type on the remove machine
summary: Cant even type on the remove machine

description: Not work but looks good. SSH will be good options to add
It just spins forever. The itopia client, on the other hand, works perfectly, which rules out network or server configuration issues.
summary: Never been able to get it to work

description: Garbage. Doesn't take a ms-rd://server type RDP address that Ubuntu defaults for desktop sharing. Use Remmina app instead. Come on Gnome team, stop making garbage apps.
works as intended, theres no fullscreen though afaik, which is alright for my use but its kinda one of the features you'd expect from an app like this
RDP is not working.
It's just unstable right now.
summary: Crashes a lot when using RDP

description: Like most things released by Gnome, it is so overly simplistic and limited in options, it is worthless except in very specific use cases. If you need commonly used business options such as attaching to a console, then you will be out of luck. Remmina is such a better option in so many ways - first of all being actually usable and configurable.
Remote Desktops clients tend to be more complex programs for a Reason. The lack of any configurations and not even allowing to import VNC or RDP files leave this app being pretty useless overall.

Upgraded to Fedora35 so thought I'd give Connections a go. Couldn't connect to Windows servers with RDP - message was Authentication Failed, but as the same credentials are working fine in Remmina there must be something more to it than that. I would investigate but as plenty of others feel this application is dud I can't really be bothered.
Gives no feedback when connections can't be established
doesn't remember login credentials, window size, doesn't fit window to remote desktop's size, etc. feels like a weekend proof of concept hack that accidentally escaped into production.

Can't save password
Can't change remote resolution

I have Linux hosted by RDP service and remnia connects without problem.

Tried connections and it did not connect.

Failed to connect to Mac over VNC as well. Too little connection configuration options to have it actually working and usable in real life.
What's the point of releasing an app that has such limited functionality. If you're going to write an app then do it properly or don't bother! Just wastes peoples valuable time.
It is very slow, practically unusable. TigerVNC works very well and is very snappy. Please fix this.

I like the idea of a simple built-in app that enabled you to remote into other machines, even Windows ones.

It works fairly well, but the problem is that it has absolutely no features ...
connection failed cause by TLS error but dont even have setting to change or configure.

It is ok for small or local machines to connect, but you cannot create groups nor does it inform you if the remote server is not known (mistype in ip config, unknown hostname) - it simply show the loading sign.
summary: Great potential but but not finished

description: You can't log into domain PCs, even using remote's local account. Other than that it works fine. Bit too simplistic though.
summary: Cannot connect to AD domain computers

description: This is a very much needed app for the Gnome desktop, but it needs to be finished, at a minimum, there needs to be resolution options. I don't know why this is even released in this state, it barely functions for what it is supposed to do.
Doesnt work Fedora 36
Every time you try to connect to RDP sessions, the application just crashes. Unusable.
The "fullscreen" mode only take half of the screen height and gives a scroll for you to scroll up and down through the entire remote screen
I have not been able to connect anywhere ...
summary: I have not been able to connect anywhere ..

description: Has never worked. Every single time I try to connect to anything it crashes. Devs haven't done anything about it.

It works, connects to my Windows machine, but is stuck at a low resolution with no options to change it, no multimonitor support and not a lot to configure. It's a good start, but for now FreeRDP is still the most usable RDP client. I like the interface.
-- Add more options, multi-monitor support that actually scales to multiple monitors
-- Add the ability to import .RDP files for easy setup.
-- Add the option to push various usb devices, reroute audio and more peripheral exchange.
summary: Not enough to be truly compelling

description: Primeiramente agradeço por desenvolverem essa ferramenta e por disponibilizá-la gratuitamente. Tem potencial para ser melhor. Problema com resolução de tela, pouca configuração para customização, telcado falha várias vezes quando conectado a um remote host RDP e VNC, teclado simplemente para de digitar, só funciona o mouse, é preciso fechar o Connections e abrir novamente para voltar a funcionar.
Keyboard shortcuts on the Windows session not working.
Thought its all GUI based click click click....nothing....wayland is still not upto just working like x11.

It's working for me and it's a great help in managing multiple systems. I like that the interface is simple and that the app creates icons for each remote computer for quick access. Maybe in the future, it would be nice to have the ability to group and organize each connection, say have all of one department's computers in one "folder/group" for more organizing capibility. This would help with service/management efficiency. To the developers, keep up the great work! It is greatly appreciated!
Didn't work at all, throws an error on join about gnome
It does work, but there's not auto scaling feature for RDP.
summary: Okay, but not good enough for daily use

description: Cannot connect to older desktops (Windows 7) due to old TLS version not supported. Cannot find any properties to support legacy TLS either.
summary: RDP Works OK only with Windows 10+ desktops

description: I really enjoy the scaling on this app. Best RDP out there not for sure!
It worked fine for around 3 or so days when I tried it out, but then it stopped accepting key inputs to my machines and other things like that. I switched to KRDC and that's been much better.

Missing very basic, core functionality. Can't even edit a connection once created. No options to even connect to console. Issues stay open for years. I have no idea why this is a shipping product, unless it is another example of Gnome minimalism. Waste of disk space.

Works (I could establish RDP & VNC connections) but I don't like software with almost no configuration options. Only some basics, I could not even edit IP address for existing connection profile. Don't recommend.
Very basic functionality. Can establish connection through rdp but cannot set resolution or change configurations. App is working but is very simple

realiza la conexion, pero usando VPN como en mi caso, lo que no tiene es la resolucion de pantalla deba una de 800 de ancho x 600 alto.

seria ajustar eso, o dejar que se anexe los valores antes de conectar.
While I like the simplicity it is nigh unusable wihtout any settings or at least the ability to change resolution, so most of the time my connections are a 640x480 blurry mess.
I use it to login to my Windows Mineraft server. It's usuable, not too many options.
with windows pc

This has become a staple in my workflow. I use it to log into my work MacBook, where I fullscreen it and use it on its own workspace. Allows me to easily switch context between work and personal stuff by using the Meta + Scroll shortcut under GNOME Wayland to switch workspaces. It's stable and works out of the box (if your networking is set-up right). Could use a bit more configurability around quality (I'd reduce quality if I can, since VNC, even over gigabit LAN, is not the fastest thing to use)
summary: Does what it says on the tin

description: touchpad gestures are missing on windows sessions so cant do two finger scrolling

Very simple app. I prefer lightweight and easy apps but this is a little bit too bare bones for my liking. You can't really configure anything other than the address and simple scaling options. I miss the option to import existing RDP files for example. Also for some reason, this app only seem to support dark style which looks "off" in my otherwise light style desktop. It's fine if you only need something to quickly connect to a remote host, but if you need more finegrained control, you should look for a different application.
summary: Very bare, maybe a bit too barebones

description:
Fedora 38 workstation
I was able to get rdp working. In my first few days I've had a few minor bugs: it has crashed once; some keys myseriously stop sending to remote until I restart the connection.
It's missing some features (idk if these are wayland growing pains): can't see remote cursor and my cursor doesn't change for hover events; if any keyboard shortcut I have is a shortcut in Gnome, Gnome will steal focus, so I cannot use most keyboard shortcuts.

It worked the first time without in issue when connecting to a Windows system. (I have not tried Linux yet). The interface is clean, simple and easy to use. 

It would be nice if I could open two or more instances side by side at one time like you can on Windows using Remote Desktop. That way if you are troubleshooting a system and need to view another system for comparison you wont need to keep going back and forth to the connections screen to change between sessions.

Disclaimer: My review is based on only one day of use.
summary: It works. A few suggestions though

description: When using RDP for Windows, it lacks the ability to copy and paste on the remote machine. Neither text or file transfer work at the moment.
Barebones, yet simple and lightweight
request latest version and more options
stuct after a few minutes of running

description: Its almost useless app as it don't support any advance configuration and device mapping.

summary: Laptop keyboard does not work on remote desktop

description: doesnt connect to Windows via RDP and has a very confusing interface. i installed Remmina afterwards and it just worked without immediately fiddling.

Unable to connect to anything with this!
Remmina is an alternative that works perfectly, I reccomend using that instead!
You don't have to configure everything. Sometimes, a sane default works.
summary: Easy to use without further configuration

description:
Perhaps the buggiest and non user friendly RDP client I've ever seen in my life. It's a real buggy mess and if you can connect, it won't stay connected for more than a few hours.

This is not the RDP app you've been looking for and frankly, a bit embaressing as a Linux app.

I do have a problem with Thincast RDP - I can connect until login propmts, then Thuncast closes itself, this basic connection app doesn't close itself and connects everythign as it should work in the first place. Recommended!
authentification failed even when authentification on network level is turned off on windows 11
summary: Do not work (tested in conjunction with win 11)

description: Gnome-like geringer Funktionsumfang. Tut aber, was es soll: Zuverlässig Verbindungen via VNC aufbauen.
summary: Probemloses und einfaches Einrichten von VNC-Verbindungen

description: Program immediatly crashes on Ubuntu 22.04
This program has basically no features. Just throw it off your system and install Remmina.
No es bueno, se cierra derrepente, no hay formas de configurarlo (resolución, tipos de cifrado en la conexión, etc)
Me ha servido a conectarme a equipos Windows Server en conjunto con Forticlient VPN
summary: EXcelente, cumple con su función de escitorio remoto

description: Debería ser muy simple, ya que tan solo admite dos tipos de conexiones. pero debido a que no tiene personalización ninguna, ni control sobre ellas, no puedes conectarte a equipos windows. lo que claramente deja la funcionalidad de esta app a la mitad
summary: No es capaz de conectarse con equipos windows

description: Al intentar conectar por RDP, no se puede aclarar el dominio del equipo e incluso al conectar indica "sucess" pero no muestra la pantalla.
Funcionar funciona, pero estás obligado a trabajar en 800x600, no da más de sí

Muy simple conectarse a equipos por RDP. Hace lo que tiene que hacer y lo hace bien. Falta poder enviar todas las señales de teclado (por ejemplo Alt+Tab es tomado por el host y no por el remoto) y que envíe de forma correcta el multitouch del touchpad (Funciona perfecto, salvo scroll con dos dedos, por ejemplo)
Keyboard stops working when setting screen size
summary: Keyboard stops working when setting screen size

description:
Ne présente aucun interet. Interface et réglages indigents. buggue et plante là ou d'autres softs fonctionnent parfaitement. Ne rien faire est encore mieux que créer des softs aussi pauvre.
Désolé pour ceux qui y travaillent.
Ne fonctionne pas avec windows 10

Dommage car l'application est bien pensée. Elle se fige souvent. Ne permet pas de réglages sur la profondeur des couleurs...
Ne permet pas de corriger un raccourci enregistré.
Choisir une option rapidité ou qualité.
Etc
Dommage
summary: Beaucoup de bugs et peu de controles

description: Приложение еще доделывать и доделывать, смысла в нем на данный момент мало

Не скажу, что отсутствие детальных настроек качества изображения и ввода это проблемы, скорее это минималистичный подход к тому, чем будешь пользоваться каждый день без нужны детально настраивать каждый параметр.
Подключается на 5 сек и приложение закрывается. Соединение RDP, на удаленном компьютере Windows Server 2012.

1. После подключения (к Wibdows 10) соединения держится 5-10 секунд и обрывается. Повторно не подключается, приходится перезагружать ПК. Есть проблемы с разрешением. 
2. Открывшийся на короткое время удалённый рабочий стол имеет разрешение 1024х768 по ощущениям (4:3).
3. Соединения не удаляются. Если создать несколько соединений и удалить, то после перезапуска программы они оказываются на месте.

VNC подключения не работают (закрываются сразу же, после ввода пароля).
RDP подключения иногда работают, но поменять разрешение, подключить локальный каталог - это всё не сюда.
Бесполезная утилита. Не подключается к удаленному рабочему столу Windows. Настроек никаких нет. Совершенно непонятно, зачем разработчики включили ее в состав дистрибутива с таким функционалом.
summary: Просто не работает при подключении к удаленному рабочем столу Windows

description: Клиент удаленного рабочего стола для среды рабочего стола GNOME
